page.title: 09TRANSPORT
page.content: The A38 is the main road serving Plymouth from the rest of the country. This road meets the large Marsh Mills roundabout, where traffic can either go to the city or its suburbs, or can join the new Parkway, which is a new inner city through road. The Parkway was opened on April 1st 1985, and runs from the Tamar Bridge to the Marsh Mills roundabout. A peak hour census taken on a July Saturday showed nearly 3,000 vehicles per hour using this roundabout. The bridge over the River Plym on the A38 is suffering from concrete cancer and will need to be repaired in a few years. All the local people want to see a new flyover road replace this bridge and join the A38 to the Parkway over the Marsh Mills roundabout.
